Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Your Money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dbronx47
Reviews.Content: You want to visit New York, but where can you stay that doesn't cost $500/night? Well, how about 254 East Vacation, just off the SW corner of 2nd Avenue. Not only are the rates half of other hotels, but you are renting an apartment with a full kitchen, in one of the top neighborhoods in New York. Just roll out of bed and whatever you desire is within walking distance, including buses and the subway. Clean, comfortable, half the price of other hotels. Give it a try, you won't be sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: TinaE129
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night on a business trip, but was pleasantly surprised. Your room is basically your own apartment in NYC. All fixtures were new, with small kitchen and livingroom and a spacious bedroom. Very clean,nicely furnished and quiet. Looking forward to going there again for a weekend getaway in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: dcachia
Reviews.Content: This is a place for somebody who is single and isn't going to spend alot of time inside. The place is small!!!! However it is clean and very central.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a native”
Reviews.Author: bluemoonkaren
Reviews.Content: Didn’t know what to expect when this establishment popped up as “least expensive place to stay” in Upper East Side NYC – but so glad we took the chance. What a refreshing change from the usual bland hotel room! More like living as a native New Yorker in the best neighborhood in NYC within walking distance to everything! Apartment was clean, comfortable and quiet, contained the necessities for apartment living and was an architectural blend of 19th century charm and tasteful modern updating. Can’t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Has anyone the NYFD ever inspected this place?”
Reviews.Author: kj l
Reviews.Content: The amenities are fine BUT there were no smoke detectors visible in my rooms any time I stayed or in the halls..no sprinklers...no second exit like a chain ladder or fire escape...just a one narrow stairway that goes from top to bottom. There is no front desk or anyone other than the guests in the building so with cooking facilities available in the rooms...this place could be a disaster waiting to happen. This would be a terrific find if the owner just brought the place up to a safe level.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, horrible communication”
Reviews.Author: ssearch
Reviews.Content: I booked this place 3 months before my check-in date. A week before check-in I emailed Danny the owner to confirm everything. He told me I was to be in a different room (the loft room which is smaller then the room I booked). I emailed him back 5 days before check-in, confused with the room switch and he responded saying he would call me the following day (why he couldn't have called me that day I do not know). Received a call from Expedia informing me that Danny overbooked my room and that they would have to find me another hotel to stay at. I don't understand why Danny couldn't have called me himself to give me the heads up or how in the world he overbooked me when I made a reservation months in advance. Therefore since I never even had the chance to stay at this hotel and based on the awful communication I rate this place "terrible" and unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Heathar
Reviews.Content: Easy check in-great location-clean-key pad gated entry-had an awesome time.-would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in NYC with 4 kids - and everyone loved our room!”
Reviews.Author: nybigbrian
Reviews.Content: July heat wave:/ Triple digit temp didn't stop the family from having a great weekend in the city. We stayed in 1A on first floor, the kids had a big spare bed and big couch to sleep on and we got the master bed. We all slept great and the AC kept us all cool. This room includes a private outdoor patio area with umbrella, table, and nice chairs. Our room was nicely decorated and very comfortable. I especially love how easy it is to walk to Central Park - a nice shady retreat from the hot sun. We also loved getting on the express bus right on 2nd Avenue for a fast ride downtown to South Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. The subway is close too (#6 Train at Lexington Ave. & 68th or 77th St.) We really love staying in the Upper East Side and enjoy the local people and shops and restaurants, while still being a short distance from Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Theater and Museums. You can't go wrong with this place if you are looking for a reasonably priced boutique hotel in a safe upscale neighborhood. We unloaded our car at the front door and I found a free parking spot two blocks away on 74th near Lexington. Would definitely return again. Thanks Danny!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Danielle620
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful neighborhood. I booked two rooms for the night, loved the room with the outdoor patio, it was nice to sit outside on a hot summer night. The apartment was very clean and decorated nicley. I would definately recommend this hotel to stay in to friends and family and will be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: ampic918
Reviews.Content: Except for the convenient location this place had nothing going for it - peeling paint, lights that didn't work, no Wifi unless you sat on the stairs in the hallway, TV in BR didn't work, dishwasher didn't work and mirrors everywhere (even on the ceiling)

Reviews.Title: “Needs Major Renovation”
Reviews.Author: NyThyme
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the place needs work. It was shabby and in desperate need of paint and a new carpet - or better yet - no carpet. Place was like a bad dorm room. Lock on door was not acceptable. TV was from the last century with no CNN or other normal cable channels. Not a bargain and certainly not for anyone who unfit to climb with the weight of their suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible member of staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Trixiebubba
Reviews.Content: Based on a phone call to 254 east vacation to ask a simple question,I would NOT recommend this accommodation!the receptionist was very curt and very rude for absolutely no reason!shouting at the top of his rude,arrogant voice for asking how much the extra guest charge is!an absolutely disgusting way to speak to a potential guest who once was prepared to spend almost £200 a night there,no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Negatives. Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Vegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April based on the location and many positive reviews. First the positives: The location is good; close to museums and restaurants. Now, cue the crickets…… The negatives: the hotel is seriously lacking in creature comforts that most travelers have become accustomed to. For example: 1. There is no elevator. That much is disclosed. What isn’t mentioned is the condition of the stairs. They are narrow and steep. They also lean to one side. I suggest chondroiton twice daily for a month prior to your trip. Its also wouldn’t hurt to make sure your health insurance is paid up in case you blow out your knee. 2. There is no cable TV in the room. Just an old TV getting local channels. OK for 1970 Orlando, unacceptable for Big Apple 2011. 3. The room doesn’t have a phone. Or a fax. There is no business center on the property. Or a concierge. Want room service? Hike down three flights and visit the saucy barmaid at the Turkish restaurant next door. 4. There is no daily maid service; trash will keep piling up until you leave. Also, your beds won’t get made. And, try not to get your towels too dirty because they wont be replaced. 5. One ply toilet paper may be good for mother earth and 254’s old pipes (in theory) but you’ll use double the amount. And don’t look for a box of tissues unless you spring for them yourself. 6. There is no central air conditioning unless you count being able to open the window half way. There is no way to regulate the temperature in the room. Not even a ceiling fan. 7. The bed is positioned inches from the radiator, which is directly beneath the window. Which is where, apparently in the summertime they install the air conditioners stored in the closets. How someone can sleep with their head inches from a blowing air conditioner remains to be seen. 8. There is a coffer maker and refrigerator in the room but no coffee. For $250 a night I kind of expected at least a one serve packet of Maxwell House. 9. If you want to use the wireless internet you’ll have to go down to the basement. Or cram in the hallway on the first floor. If you are in a room on the second, third or fourth floor you are out of luck. 10. The nightstand is a foldout food tray. I didn’t check to see if it was IKEA. 11. The place could use a dusting. While I did wake up the first morning with a bug crawling on my hand it wasn’t a bedbug, so I’m grateful for that. In sum I liked the location, which is walking distance to a lot of good places to eat and the museums. But for $250 a night I felt like I got ripped off. Bottom line: 254 is seriously lacking in amenities and needs major upgrades or a big time drop in price

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming, Nostalgic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaBPA
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this wonderful boutique-style hotel in April 2010 to attend a friend's bachelorette party. I went to grad school in NYC in the Upper East Side so I was very familiar with the location. I stayed in the studio on the top floor. I was very pleased with the accomodations. Best of all, it is close to everything in NYC that I love! I would highly recommend this to anyone who is planning a trip to NYC for ANY occasion! There are great restaurants all around and you are a stone's throw from 5th Avenue, Central Park and the Met.

Reviews.Title: “Great price. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Narrajack
Reviews.Content: As a former NY'er I was glad to find this place. It was clean, quiet and in a good spot. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again, and I am picky about where I stay. I did a full bed bug investigation and found not a one! As it is an apt building with tenants still living in there (at least in the building I stayed in); it may not be for everyone. But if you want resonable prices and a safe place to hang your hat you can't go wrong. Jack M.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Nostalgia, Manhattan Charm. Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: sfurniss2312
Reviews.Content: Great location on Manhattan's Upper East Side. Walking distance to everything. Very clean, spacious rooms. Charming. Feels like you are a resident of the city while staying there. Beautiful, nostalgic building. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location......”
Reviews.Author: magster50
Reviews.Content: Great location, no bed bugs, walked everywhere. The price was good for the location. Shared a suite with 2 others. Two slept in comfy bed with memory foam, the other person slept on a fold out cot - which was rather uncomfortable. Everything was okay- not fancy. Walked up three flights of stairs with our cases - and we are over 60 years of age! Small fridge/coffee maker and microwave in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are paying for!”
Reviews.Author: gwag
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was the first time staying at one of these NY "apartment" hotels. Accommodations are not anything like a chain hotel nor are they like a B & B. The unit we were in was in a building shared by people that live there year round. There is no place to check in or go to if you have any questions. At one point near check in time, we tried calling the telephone number and got an automated message. Luckily, it wasn't something that we needed an immediate response for. The "suite" was clean but a bit old - red carpeting and gold bedding. Seemed the bed and living area should have been reversed but somehow it was OK. There was a small refrigerator in the room as well as a coffe pot however, there were no filters or coffee in the room so unless you went out and bought your own filters and can of coffee (or tea) it was useless. Bathroom was clean, however, the door's handle was a just a turning lock (no handle) and it squeaked terribly. The entry door to the building, which was accessible by a code given to us prior to check-in - was unlocked more than locked during our 2 night stay. Our room was a 2-floor walkup and we certainly heard comings and goings for tenants during the wee hours of the night. Having said all this, we probably paid at least $100 LESS than any other room available in the area and did get to stay on the upper East Side, which is where we wanted to be. Very safe neighborhood with great restaurants. Bring your own tissues as they are not provided but there is a huge - like 65" -big screen TV. Go figure! Not a bad stay if you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and homey feeling in the heart of New York!”
Reviews.Author: Yramesor
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New York was an absolute blast. I travelled with my sister and we stayed in the Upper East Side in an apartment hotel we found on line for a steal.The 254 East Vacation is on a quiet and safe residential street. The apartment itself was very clean and spacious, trendy and had a homey feeling.The living room was huge with leather sofas, big screen tv over a fireplace and two small bay windows overlooking the tree lined street below, I felt very much like Carrie in her apartment in "Sex in the City." The location is perfect to all New York has to offer. We walked to Braodway for a play (1.8 miles) and Central Park for a carriage ride (only 5 blocks walk).Also great restaurants in the area.La Guardia only a short drive away. I would also recommend "On Board" bus tour. With a tour guide and airconditioned bus and water you get to see and experience all the major attractions in one day! We spent 3 days and four nights and saw and did all there was to see and do in this great city.Would happily return and stay at this apartment/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: SteveZNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Upper East Side made us feel like real New Yorkers. We were within walking distance of many of the art museums and Central Park and the subway was just a few blocks away. Having a small kitchen was great for having leftovers from some of the good restaurants nearby (Amber, Candle Cafe). Only negative was the lack of WiFi. I would have to go to a nearby coffee shop to get access.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the pictures on the website!”
Reviews.Author: computraveler
Reviews.Content: Not like the pictures on the website, needs major cleaning and updating. Wireless did not seem to work well as everyone was sitting on the stairs in the hall as we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mary195710
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were in the city for a mixture of business and pleasure. We needed a place that was convenient, clean, and affordable. I have to say (and I am an experienced traveler) all of our expectations were met. My niece lives on the upper east side so this of course was a perfect location. One reviewer complained about the narrow staircase. Anyone should realize what a walkup without elevators means, and this was no problem to my sister and I even though we are in our 50s. A few years ago I went the very expensive route of hotels on the upper east side and was not happy with the amenities. These acccomodations are exactly as advertised and went above my expectations. I plan on staying there again and again as long as my niece lives where she lives. Thank you Danny for making our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “New York "New York style"”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbizzymom
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews, I was not sure what to expect. I booked the one bedroom apartment for myself and two teenage daughters for one night "spur of the moment" one day before my visit to NYC. The confirmation via e-mail was prompt and I received a telephone call the next morning regarding the doorlock combination and the quite unorthodox check-in method. It was actually easier than checking into a regular hotel. The starirs are a little steep and your legs get a good work out. There is no elevator, so travel light. The kitchen and sitting areas are small, but comfortable. The bedroom with two double beds was actually quite large for NYC standards and has ample closet space. The beds were very comfortable and there were plenty extra pillows and blankets in the closet.The only change I would make would be the location of the beds. One double bed was right under the window AC unit and it became quite arctic at night for the person sleeping in that bed. The promised amenities were all present, clean and in good working order. The bathroom looked a little worn, but was clean and the shower had great water pressure and ws nice and hot. My daughters loved having an appartment rather than just one room in a hotel. Location is great in a nice neighborhood with ample shops and eating establishments right aroung the corner. It takes about half an hour to walk to midtown and the theater district, but the walk is nice and plenty of stores to explore on the way. There are lots of taxis around if you choose not to walk, but hey, when is New York, do as the New Yorkers (and walk!) Central Park is only 10 minutes walking away. If you are looking for marble tiled bathrooms and room service, this is not the place for you, but if you are just looking for a place to relax and put your feet up after a day of exploring the city, this works very well. Having the kitchen is nice and will save you some $$ if you eat breakfast and snacks "at home". We found a indoor parking facility for our car one block over on 75th and were charged $34.- for 24 hours, which is pretty much the standard rate in this area. We enjoyed the New York flavor of the appartment and will definitely consider returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “Live just like a New Yorker”
Reviews.Author: NelsStewart
Reviews.Content: We've fallen in love with vacation apartments during recent trips to Europe, so we wanted to replicate the experience of feeling a bit like a native during our recent five-day holiday in New York. Vacation apartments aren't quite as common in North America, but 254 East Vacation fit the bill quite adequately. It's well-situated on a quiet (well, quiet for NYC), tree-lined street in the Upper East Side, close to 2nd Avenue. The 77th Street subway stop, on the 6 line, is about an eight minute walk. As that's the only line that services the Upper East Side, it's usually pretty busy. The immediate neighborhood is choc-a-bloc with restaurants and bistros like J.G. Melons, and the Orsay. In fact, there's a fine Turkish restaurant right next door, another just around the corner. If you want to do it yourself, there's no shortage of delis and green grocers nearby, and an excellent full-service grocerateria, D'Agostinos, about a six-minute walk away on Lexington Avenue. We were booked into the no. 3 apartment at 252 74th St. We called Danny, the proprietor, upon our arrival at JFK, he gave us the code to get in the front door, and our keys would be on the table in the open apartment. He happened to meet us at the door when we got there, and that was the first and last we saw of him, which is part of the appeal of vacation apartments, total independence. The apartment itself is up a couple of flights of creakity, narrow stairs. The two adjoining buildings seem to be a mix of vacation units and apartments for permanent residents. The apartment consisted of a living room, a sleeping area with a queen bed in an annex and a small bathroom, which was spotless. The "kitchen" is really just a small fridge with a microwave sitting on top. There's a selection of plates, bowls, cups and cutlery on a shelf unit. We only really planned to eat breakfast there, but it would have been nice were there a small kitchen cart/table in the apartment to be used as a prep area. We had to wash our dishes in the bathroom sink, as that's the only part of the apartment with plumbing. The apartment is also equipped with a small air conditioner in one of its two windows, and a massive 50-inch plasma tv; I'm sure few of the top-end hotels in NYC even have that! Be sure to scan beyond the basic cable channels to get to some high-def and digital channels. The information sheet on the coffee table says WiFi is only accessible from the first floor hallway, but we were able to hook into the network no problem. As we weren't scheduled to fly out until the evening of our final day, Danny had no problem storing our gear for the day outside his office after we checked out; certainly beats lugging our stuff around for the day, as we saw many people apparently doing during a lunch stop at Bryant Park.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE, RUNNNNN!”
Reviews.Author: puntico
Reviews.Content: Please, the pictures and description of this place is not even close to the reallity of this "hotel " Do not let the location fool you!!!! Very tiny building, very tiny rooms, no elevetor in a four floor building, vary narrow stair (if you are carring a standard size luggage, you will need to carried on your shoulder)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for independent travelers!”
Reviews.Author: Junie99
Reviews.Content: I would not term this a hotel as much as an apartment rental. If you expect a concierge and daily maid service, you should find a regular hotel... but if you look at this as if you're borrowing someone's apartment, you will find it comfortable, spacious, sunny, clean, safe and very well located (4 blocks from the subway), with a well-equipped kitchen for making light meals. No elevator, but the two apartments we tried were located on the second and third floors, and were easy to get up to.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kelster71
Reviews.Content: I lived in NYC for many years and I HATE staying in the huge midtown hotels. This was a small apartment (just like living in NYC), in a great neighborhood. I felt like a local again! It was comfortable, quiet, clean, convenient - all good. If you want to stay in a hotel, this is not a good choice. If you want to live like a local, this is a perfect option (and the price was right!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Not so nice place....”
Reviews.Author: ValCarlsbad_CA
Reviews.Content: We chose 254 East vacations because we needed more room than a standard NY hotel at a price we could afford. So, the price part was fine. I got a reasonable rate. The locations is fine. Close to markets, shops, restaurants, subway, central park, etc. However, for a 9 night stay, we did not get any housekeeping. I had to take out the trash every couple of days. No clean towels or bedding...that is kind of roughing it for the group of females I had. One roll of tissue paper. Little things that added up to make us leave that apartment for as long as possible. We stayed in1A. It had overhead noise, outside noise and its own internal loud sounds that we never could identify. This unit has a converted kitchen into a bedroom - which is very weird as the tiny kitchen is at the foot of the bed and the bathroom is 3 feet away from the bed. Yuck. The main room was nice, except the couch was not comfortable as reported and the teenage girls had to take turns on who got the bed. Although it is nicely decorated, the decorations are just covering up very old, thickly painted walls. I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unwanted visitors”
Reviews.Author: theatreproducer
Reviews.Content: East Vacation is hardly the fashionable upscale site it appears to be from its website. fine if you are looking into other peoples uptown apartments in the same street but Danny's East 74th is dirty, run down, badly in need of a complete makeover. its motel hell, cheap fittings, 1980's decor, no real sense of being in an aparthotel. There is no cleaning regime and to cap it all we were visited by mice in the last few days on our ten day stay. droppings were evident under the kitchen sink and cooker/fridge. the rooms weren't even vaccumned nor any litter removed - no wonder he attracts mice. we complained on day 9 after being chided for leaving a tied up bag of trash on the stairwell. his answer was to put down glue traps. This place is simply is not worth the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Experience”
Reviews.Author: dpierce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 254 East Vacation for almost a week and had a pretty good time. It's not quite a hotel and not quite a bed and breakfast… So, if you want either of those, I might suggest looking somewhere else. However, if you're looking for a more authentic stay in New York City, then this might be the location for you. 254 East Vacation is tucked away on the upper west side, just a few blocks from the subway. I enjoyed its perfect location; just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of midtown to find decently priced food and drinks. It was also important for me to find a quiet place that I could escape to at the end of busy day of sightseeing. It was nice to see a large room that fit two full sized beds comfortably. The room had a small sitting area, which had a foldout couch, and there was also a kitchenette. The Bathroom was a good size and the water stayed hot enough for three separate showers a day. I've noticed some people complaining about walking up the stairs. They were narrower then I’m used to. So, if you have rather wide baggage, you might want to request the first or second floor. Don’t expect house-keeping to come around and clean up after you, change your sheets or provide you with clean towels (unless you phone them, your on your own) The bathroom really could use some renovating, not that it was especially dirty, it was just really aged. All in all, I had a great experience at 254 East Vacation and I would seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jeehannah
Reviews.Content: i'm sorry to have taken so long to write this review, but that is no reflection on the apartment or location. everything about this place is quirky and wonderful. just a nice size, great location and fab restaurants and shops on your doorstep. a great walk into manhattan, getting to shop at less 'showy' but equally great stores on the way. the local bars are great too and the raspberry martinis are to die for and dirt cheap!!!! we took a couple of nights around the greenwich area and then bleeker street but the people were friendlier and the atmos better around the apartment area so we chose to stay in around there and get to know the locals. great place and will be coming back in 2008 for more. one more thing, danny the super is the best!! a must is the thai restaurant around the corner - gorgeous food for very little money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not nearly as nice as described on the 254eastvacation.com website...”
Reviews.Author: Kathyp100
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to NYC so we don't have a good basis for comparison, but overall we were somewhat disappointed with our stay here. We spent 3 nights at 254 East Vacation and paid $300/night for a suite on the second floor that had 2 double beds in a small bedroom, a fold out couch in a very small sitting area, an extremely small galley kitchen, and an outdated bathroom. For less money we have stayed in some very nice 2 bedroom oceanfront condos in some of the nicest beach resorts in the U.S. But, I guess it's really not fair to try to make a comparison between Manhattan and a beach resort. The wireless internet didn't work well. The sink drain in the bathroom was clogged, the single electrical outlet in the bathroom (on the light over the sink) is not GFI protected, the window A/C is directly behind one of the double beds, and the whole apartment had a less-than-clean feeling to it. The kitchen is too small to do much cooking in, there is no dishwasher and clean-up in the tiny sink is a hassle. The TV in the sitting area was broken, but the one in the bedroom worked okay. There is no daily maid service. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable, the linens were clean, and the window A/C did cool the small apartment sufficiently - if we ran it non-stop. The location is great, right in the heart of the upper east side, and it was fairly quiet. Just a few blocks walk to the subway station, Central Park, and a variety of restaurants. If you stay here, the subway really is the way to travel. It can take forever to try to get anywhere in a cab because the traffic is horrendous. The subways are very inexpensive ($2/ride, or 6 rides for $10) and although they can seem intimidating at first it doesn't take long to figure out which trains go where. The trains are air conditioned, but the stations are not and can be pretty hot. Fortunately the trains run very frequently and you never have to wait very long in the station. Overall, I guess we would stay here again, but it's hard to give it a ringing endorsement. I rated it 3 stars, but would give it a 2.5 if that were an option.

HotelInfo.Name: 254 East Vacation
HotelInfo.Address: 254 East 74th Street, New York City, NY 10021
